page.title: 03KEHELLAND MET STATION 1
page.content: Kehelland Meteorological Station is a Ministry of Defence Upper Air Station,one of only eight in the United Kingdom.An Upper Air Station measures and records air pressure,air temperature and humidity,wind speed and direction with the use of Radio Sonde Balloons.These hydrogen filled balloons are launched four times each twenty four hours and automatically tracked by radar.The Radio Sonde transmits information to a control room computer for the seventy minutes or so of its flight,during which it reaches a height of approximately twenty five kilometres.After that, the balloon bursts.The information collected is passed onto Bracknell Weather Centre.Other interesting features at Kehelland include a rain_seeking Radome with an eighty mile radius.
